payload.description: Applitools Eyes SDK for Javascript (Unified Repo)

issue.title: [eyes-cypress] add type definition for eyes plugin
issue.body:
[Trello](https://trello.com/c/EiZummQg/1529-cypress-typescript-support-improvement-island)

This change will stop throwing error for the code below

```typescript

import eyes from '@applitools/eyes-cypress'
import { defineConfig } from 'cypress'
const config = defineConfig({
  fixturesFolder: false,
  video: false,
})
eyes(config) // Error, This expression is not callable.  Type 'typeof import("@applitools/eyes-cypress/index")' has no call signatures.

```

comment.body:
@zamboney an e2e test for this is taking the snippet you put in the description, and actually running it in an automated test. This is how to prove that the code actually solves this case.
I think it's important to add such a test and not just change `index.js` to `index.ts`.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -104,7 +104,7 @@ Apollo SDK:
   feature:
     - 
   bug-fix:
-    - 
+    - Add typescript definition for eyes plugin
comment.body: I would move this from `bug-fix` to `feature` and write `Support ESM and TypeScript in Applitools' config file`. I hope this is indeed the nature of this PR.

repo.name: eyes.sdk.javascript1
repo.description: Applitools Eyes SDK for Javascript (Unified Repo)

review.body:
This looks good to me. 2 comments:
1. The case of `fully` region should also be covered. You can see in line 44 that it's the same logic as the `else` when `isScrollable` is `null`.
2. The test IMO should be just like other screenshoter tests, where before taking the screenshot you would scroll the page. I would cover both default *and* custom `scrollingElement`.

pull_request.title: Add the scroll offset to region
pull_request.body:
## Add to the region offset the scroll offset.

The calculation of the region base of the [`getBoundingClientRect`](https://github.com/applitools/eyes.sdk.javascript1/blob/07d0fb36b5ce7ecb88c3d4854871686d082b664c/js/packages/snippets/src/browser/getElementRect.js#L13), the `getBoundingClientRect` calculate the offset ["relative to the viewport"](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/getBoundingClientRect).

This is a problem if the test scrolls the page before before `eyes.check` because it's trying to move to the `region` while `"SER"` is already scrolled

This fix the issue by adding to the `x` and `y` coordinates of the `region` the
scroll `x` and `y` coordinates.

this will also solve [1528-msft-classic-testim-bad-screenshot](https://trello.com/c/610tyGMr/1528-msft-classic-testim-bad-screenshot) ticket

## Testing

TBD;

repo.name: eyes.sdk.javascript1
repo.description: Applitools Eyes SDK for Javascript (Unified Repo)

repo.name: eyes.sdk.javascript1
repo.description: Applitools Eyes SDK for Javascript (Unified Repo)

issue.title: Storybook add tiemout and retry for take dom snapshots
issue.body:
[Trello card](https://trello.com/c/QN2p1v0O/1401-cvent-storybook-execution-hanging)
To solve the issue above, I set a timeout on `takeDomSnapshots` and if we fail, we retry in `renderStories`

comment.body:
@kyryloonufriiev @SophieDePaula yes, it was very strange. This is exactly where we were looking, but Puppeteer seems to behave in a weird way, the poll script is not resolving or rejecting, as Sophie said.
Without deeply understanding Puppeteer's behavior here, we went with a solution that will first solve the issue for the customer, and then we can investigate offline.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -61,7 +61,7 @@ Apollo SDK:
   feature:
     - 
   bug-fix:
-    - 
+    - Add a timeout when taking DOM per story and add a retry
comment.body:
@SophieDePaula I think @benbabayoff8 meant that from the user's perspective, the timeout is not interesting since it's an implementation detail, and the important part is about the retry. So I think something like this:

> Prevent Eyes-Storybook from hanging when there is a failure to take DOM.

pull_request.title: Storybook add tiemout and retry for take dom snapshots
pull_request.body:
[Trello card](https://trello.com/c/QN2p1v0O/1401-cvent-storybook-execution-hanging)
To solve the issue above, I set a timeout on `takeDomSnapshots` and if we fail, we retry in `renderStories`
